com.hazelcast.internal.networking

Interface ChannelOutboundHandler<F extends OutboundFrame>

  • Type Parameters:
    F -
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ClientMessageEncoder, PacketEncoder, TextEncoder

    public interface ChannelOutboundHandler<F extends OutboundFrame>
    Responsible for writing OutboundFrame to a ByteBuffer. For example a Packet needs to be written to a socket, then it is taken from the queue of pending packets, the ChannelOutboundHandler is called with the Packet and the socket buffer as argument and will then write the content of the packet to the buffer. And on completion, the content of the buffer is written to the socket. ChannelOutboundHandler are not expected to be thread-safe; each channel will gets its own instance(s). A ChannelOutboundHandler is constructed through a ChannelInitializer. For more information about the ChannelOutboundHandler (and handlers in generally), have a look at the ChannelInboundHandler. If the main task of a ChannelOutboundHandler is to encode a message (e.g. a Packet), it is best to call this handler an encoder. For example PacketEncoder.
    See Also:
    EventLoopGroup, ChannelInboundHandler, ChannelInitializer, ChannelErrorHandler, Channel

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean onWrite(F frame, ByteBuffer dst)
      A callback to indicate that the Frame should be written to the destination ByteBuffer.

    • Method Detail

      • onWrite

        boolean onWrite(F frame,
                ByteBuffer dst)
         throws Exception
        A callback to indicate that the Frame should be written to the destination ByteBuffer. It could be that a Frame is too big to fit into the ByteBuffer in 1 go; in that case this call will be made for the same Frame multiple times until write returns true.
        Parameters:
        frame - the Frame to write
        dst - the destination ByteBuffer
        Returns:
        true if the Frame is completely written
        Throws:
        Exception - if something fails while writing to ByteBuffer. When an exception is thrown, the ChannelErrorHandler is called.
